channel.title: How do i convert item_def2.java ints to class8.java ints
channel.description:
Ok welt i recently got torva models and ints for a 317 from a friend and i never seen these types of ints before i am talking about item_def2.java ints i never seen them because i only have class8.java and itemdef2.java ints do not work in class8.java obviosly so i was wondering is there a way to convert the ints to class8.java and if so can some one teach me? i was also wondering if the models are the same for both? so if there is a way to convert those ints and some one could teech me it would be greatly appreciated o and if there isnt a way to convert them and some one has the class8.java models and ints for a 317 rsps ide be very great full to have them to download. please get back to me!!! :D
o and if any one can help me with this and i succesfully get torva into my game i will give you free donator status in game and full torva once my server is up (my server isnt up yet i am waiting for torva =])

item.title: How do i convert item_def2.java ints to class8.java ints
item.dc:creator: @Dick_Salad Dick Salad
item.description:
@Dick_Salad wrote:

no that didnt work screwed up my whole client good thing i test every thing on a different client and source first i just need some normal class8.java models and ints you know were theres 3 ints for helm top and bottem and models that i extract to my models folder and i put the ints into class8.java thats it thats how i add most items idk why torva is different?

Read full topic
item.source: How do i convert item_def2.java ints to class8.java ints

item.title: How do i convert item_def2.java ints to class8.java ints
item.dc:creator: @Squirt_Ltd Squirt Ltd
item.description:
@Squirt_Ltd wrote:

Ints for Torva (place this into your client.java, directly under import java.io.*;).

    if(i == 18235)
    {
        class8.aStringArray189 = new String[5];
        class8.aStringArray189[1] = "Wear";
        class8.anIntArray126 = new int[2];
        class8.anIntArray168 = new int[2];
        class8.anIntArray156[0] = 43072;
        class8.anIntArray160[0] = 4050;
        class8.anIntArray156[1] = 7456;
        class8.anIntArray160[1] = 8541;
        class8.anIntArray156[2] = 22446;
        class8.anIntArray160[2] = 4550;
        class8.anIntArray156[3] = 22924;
        class8.anIntArray160[3] = 4550;
        class8.anInt174 = 190;
        class8.anInt181 = 130;
        class8.anInt190 = 580;
        class8.anInt198 = 8;
        class8.anInt204 = 63;
        class8.anInt169 = 10;
        class8.anInt194 = -4;
        class8.anInt165 = 35;
        class8.anInt200 = 78;
        class8.anInt188 = 17;
        class8.anInt164 = 341;
        class8.anInt175 = -1;
        class8.anInt197 = -1;
        class8.aString170 = "Torva";
        class8.aByteArray178 = "Torva description".getKytes(i);
    }

http://uppit.com/0ocfvgpwdxa0/object.7z , Put this into your cache but delete main_file_cache.idx0, main_file_cache.idx1, main_file_cache.idx3, main_file_cache.idx4 first! Donâ€™t simple rename it because that will cause the Client to stop loading.

And the last step, add this in Animable.java, directly under Model getRotatedModel()

public static void Torva() {
TorvaWield = addTorvaWield(117);
Torva bonus = addTorvaBonus(118);
tab.totalChildren(9);
tab.child(0, 141, 0, 1);

scroll.totalChildren(3);

int[] iId = {
		168, 169, 164, 185, 142, 163, 13360, 171, 167, 170,
		13366, 13368, 166, 133863, 133264, 133365, 161, 111800, 13362, 13367,
		172, 13369, 13883, 13384, 667, 6203, 6506, 6686, 18464, 18465,
		15166,  18646, 154
};

Enjoy!
